title: Repository.clear() generates incorrect sql for Oracle
body:
## Issue Description

The generated sql for the `clear()` method does not work in Oracle.

### Expected Behavior

There needs to be quotation marks around both the schema and table name, or none at all.

`truncate table "SCHEMA"."TABLE_NAME"`

### Actual Behavior

`truncate table "SCHEMA.TABLE_NAME"`

```
truncate table "SCHEMA.TABLE_NAME"
Error report -
ORA-00942: table or view does not exist
00942. 00000 -  "table or view does not exist"
*Cause:    
*Action:
```

### Steps to Reproduce

```typescript
import "reflect-metadata";
import { createConnection, Entity, PrimaryColumn } from "typeorm";

@Entity('TEST_USER')
export class User {
    @PrimaryColumn()
    username: string;
}

createConnection({
    type: "oracle",
    username: "",
    password: "",
    schema: "", // only errors when the schema is explicitly provided
    connectString: "",
    synchronize: true,
    logging: true,
    entities: [User],
}).then(async connection => {
    await connection.manager.getRepository(User).clear()
}).catch(error => console.log(error));
```

### My Environment

| Dependency          | Version  |
| ---                 | ---      |
| Operating System    |          |
| Node.js version     | v14.17.0 | <!-- run `node -v` to obtain this -->
| Typescript version  | v3.3.3333 | <!-- run `npm list typescript` to obtain this -->
| TypeORM version     | v0.2.34 | <!-- run `npm list typeorm` to obtain this -->


### Additional Context

<!--
  Add any other context about the bug report here.
-->
